subject: History
title: The Haitian Revolution
description: Learn The Haitian Revolution in one minute.

hook.text: Enslaved people in Haiti defeated Napoleon's army and created the first free Black republic. The world tried to forget.

buildup.text: Saint-Domingue was the Caribbean's richest colonyâ€”built on sugar, coffee, and the labor of 500,000 enslaved Africans.

discovery.text: In 1791, enslaved people rose up under Toussaint Louverture. They defeated French, Spanish, and British armies.

twist.text: Napoleon sent 40,000 troops to reconquer Haiti. Yellow fever killed most of them. The enslaved people won.

climax.text: Haiti declared independence in 1804. France forced it to pay reparations for lost 'property'â€”enslaved humans.

punchline.text: The slaves freed themselvesâ€”then paid their enslavers.

quiz.question: What did France demand from Haiti after independence?
options: The return of all French-owned land
